context: In 2020, Toast was a privately-held restaurant technology company founded in 2011, focused on providing cloud-based POS and restaurant management systems built on Android. The company was rapidly growing in the fragmented restaurant POS market (800,000-900,000 US restaurant locations) with approximately 8% market penetration. Toast competed in a landscape of both general-purpose POS systems (like Square) and restaurant-specific solutions, differentiating itself through its integrated, all-in-one platform specifically designed for restaurants, 24/7 customer support, and Android-based hardware that offered more customization than iPad-based competitors.

competitors.name: Square
competitors.notes: Largest competitor with general-purpose POS system that serves both retail and restaurants. Known for transparent pricing, modern interface, and strong presence in small business market. Square was more retail-focused but competed heavily in the restaurant space, particularly for counter-service and quick-service establishments.

competitors.name: Lightspeed Restaurant
competitors.notes: Cloud-based restaurant iPad POS system with comprehensive features and robust third-party integrations. Designed for fine dining, franchises, and large restaurant groups. Higher cost alternative to Toast with powerful back-end features for inventory and multi-location management.

competitors.name: TouchBistro
competitors.notes: iPad-based POS system focused on restaurant-specific needs with strong offline capabilities. More affordable than Toast with robust back office and inventory management. Locally installed system providing full offline functionality, ideal for independent full-service restaurants.

competitors.name: Clover
competitors.notes: Restaurant and retail POS system offering customizable features, wide range of hardware options, and third-party app integrations. Competed on flexibility and accepting more payment options than Toast, with no contract requirements.

competitors.name: Upserve
competitors.notes: Restaurant-industry-specific POS system with lower market presence but strong customer satisfaction. Designed exclusively for food and beverage businesses.

competitors.name: Revel Systems
competitors.notes: iPad-based POS system that was a notable competitor in the restaurant space, particularly for multi-location restaurants. Used Apple's iOS platform versus Toast's Android approach.

competitors.name: Aloha Cloud POS
competitors.notes: Traditional restaurant POS provider transitioning to cloud-based solutions. Established player in the restaurant technology space with deep industry roots.

competitors.name: CAKE by Mad Mobile
competitors.notes: Restaurant-specific POS and guest engagement platform competing in the full-service restaurant segment.
